intro: Ceroxylon australe, commonly known as the New Zealand tea tree, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white flowers. The plant is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are used traditionally by Māori for their medicinal properties. The plant's resilience to coastal conditions makes it an important component of New Zealand's native flora.
